column4: Is there a nice GUI app for editing fstab, like how gparted is a nice GUI app for fdisk?
fstab is just a text file
Yes, I'm aware of what fstab is.
But editing fstab, especially to add a new drive, requires lots of consultation with the man page to get the options right.
A nice GUI app would make it easier to edit, especially for the average desktop user.
you have a good point, perhaps file a new item in brainstorm
I just did that yesterday
I used: /dev/sdb1       /mnt/sdb1       ext3    defaults,errors=remount-ro 0       2
Is it unimaginative that all of my HD mount points are /a, /b, and /z ?
Here's what I just used:   /dev/sdb1 /b auto nouser,atime,auto,rw,nodev,noexec,nosuid 0 0
ah, ok, well I just used the fstab entry for /dev/sda1 as a template for my /dev/sdb1
I went through the whole man page and assembled all of the options that I felt were appropriate.
good job
Would've been a lot nicer to just have a GUI with a bunch of checkboxes for each option and a description of what it does.
you should brainstorm that idea, it's nice
Well, I've been editing fstab since Red Hat 6, so it's not exactly foreign to me, but I figured there'd be a GUI by now.
Ooooh, look what I found:  http://brainstorm.ubuntu.com/idea/323/
nice find!
If you have a Brainstorm account, please vote it up.
will do
voted :) Thanks for the info
